page.title: 13Boarbank Hall
page.content: Nestling amongst trees on a hill near Allithwaite stands{Boarbank Hall. It was built in the 19th century and purchased by the Nuns of the{Nursing {Order of the Augustinians}in 1921. The Nuns run a convalescent home for all denominations,nursing the old,sick and terminally ill with unfailing love consideration and strength. The Hall provides work for many local people.The local community helps the home by organising and supporting fund raising activities. Besides their dedicated nursing the Nuns still devote their lives to God and his service.Their days begin with prayer and worship at 05.45, and they spend time in prayer during the day.A bell signals days end at 21.30 At Boarbank there is a beautiful,but simple{L-shaped chapel}where both the sisters and public worship.
